candidate: He forgot to reply to the message yesterday.
reference: He didn’t respond to the message yesterday like he was supposed to.

candidate: The meeting was moved to next Monday.
reference: The meeting has been rescheduled and will now take place next Monday.

candidate: Scientists discovered a new type of coral in the Pacific Ocean.
reference: A new coral species has been identified by researchers in the Pacific.

candidate: She finally passed her driving test on the second attempt.
reference: After failing once, she managed to pass her driving test on the second try.

candidate: The restaurant will close early tonight due to maintenance.
reference: Because maintenance is scheduled, the restaurant will shut earlier than usual tonight.

candidate: The government announced a new tax policy this morning.
reference: A new taxation plan was revealed by the government earlier today.

candidate: Heavy rain caused several roads to flood overnight.
reference: Numerous roads were flooded last night because of the heavy rainfall.

candidate: The company is planning to open two new offices next year.
reference: Next year, the company intends to expand by opening two additional offices.

candidate: He deleted the file by accident.
reference: He removed the file unintentionally.

candidate: The new law will come into effect in January.
reference: The newly approved legislation will be enforced starting in January.

candidate: The teacher encouraged students to ask more questions.
reference: The teacher motivated the students to be more curious and ask questions.

candidate: She didn't recognise him at first because he had shaved his beard.
reference: She didn't realise it was him initially since he had shaved off his beard.

candidate: The match was cancelled because of a power outage.
reference: A power failure led to the cancellation of the match.

candidate: The team celebrated after winning the championship.
reference: The team held a celebration following their championship victory.

candidate: He paid the bill before leaving the restaurant.
reference: He settled the payment before walking out of the restaurant.

candidate: The store will offer discounts throughout the weekend.
reference: The shop will provide sales and discounts all weekend long.

candidate: Doctors say the medicine may cause mild headaches.
reference: According to doctors, the medication could result in minor headaches.

candidate: The museum opened a new exhibition on ancient Egypt.
reference: A new exhibit featuring ancient Egypt has been launched at the museum.

candidate: She lost her passport during the trip.
reference: Her passport went missing while she was travelling.

candidate: Gas prices increased again this month.
reference: Fuel costs have risen once more this month.

candidate: The train was delayed due to technical issues.
reference: Technical problems caused the train to run late.

candidate: The app was updated to fix several bugs.
reference: The latest app update resolved multiple glitches.

candidate: He forgot where he parked the car.
reference: He couldn’t remember the location where he had left his car.

candidate: The dog barked loudly at the delivery driver.
reference: The dog made a loud noise when the delivery person arrived.

candidate: The project deadline has been extended by two weeks.
reference: The project timeline was pushed back by an extra two weeks.

candidate: She decided to quit her job and start a business.
reference: She left her job to begin her own business venture.

candidate: Students protested against the decision to raise tuition fees.
reference: A student protest took place after tuition fees were increased.

candidate: The flight landed safely despite bad weather.
reference: Even with rough weather, the plane touched down safely.

candidate: The movie received mixed reviews from critics.
reference: Critics gave the film a combination of positive and negative feedback.

candidate: He saved money by cooking at home instead of eating out.
reference: He reduced expenses by preparing meals at home rather than dining out.

candidate: The teacher marked all the papers over the weekend.
reference: The teacher graded the assignments during the weekend.

candidate: They adopted a dog from the local shelter.
reference: A dog from the local shelter was adopted by them.

candidate: The streets were empty early in the morning.
reference: Nobody was out on the streets early in the morning.

candidate: The software will no longer support older devices.
reference: Older devices will not be compatible with the new software update.

candidate: She forgot to water the plants for a week.
reference: She neglected the plants and didn’t water them for a week.

candidate: The phone battery died while he was on a call.
reference: The call ended because his phone battery ran out.

candidate: The store ran out of milk before noon.
reference: The supermarket sold all its milk before lunchtime.

candidate: He translated the document into Spanish.
reference: The document was converted into Spanish by him.

candidate: The new stadium can hold up to 60,000 people.
reference: The stadium has a maximum seating capacity of sixty thousand spectators.

candidate: She promised to return the book tomorrow.
reference: She assured them she would bring the book back the next day.

candidate: The class voted to change the presentation date.
reference: The students collectively decided to reschedule the presentation.

candidate: He spilled coffee on his laptop.
reference: His laptop got coffee spilled on it.

candidate: Police are searching for the missing hiker.
reference: Authorities are looking for the hiker who disappeared.

candidate: The temperature dropped suddenly last night.
reference: The weather became noticeably colder overnight.

candidate: They repaired the bridge after the storm damaged it.
reference: The bridge was fixed after it was destroyed by the storm.

candidate: He forgot to set an alarm and overslept.
reference: He overslept because he didn’t set his alarm.

candidate: The singer released a new album today.
reference: A new album by the singer was launched today.

candidate: The child fell asleep during the movie.
reference: The child dozed off in the middle of the film.

candidate: The city hosted a marathon last weekend.
reference: A marathon event took place in the city last weekend.

candidate: She recycled all the plastic bottles at home.
reference: She put every plastic bottle in the recycling bin.

candidate: The airport installed more security scanners.
reference: Additional security machines were set up at the airport.

candidate: The scientist published a paper on climate change.
reference: A research paper on climate change was released by the scientist.

candidate: He registered for the online course last night.
reference: He signed up for the web-based course yesterday evening.

candidate: The library will reopen after renovation next month.
reference: After renovation, the library is scheduled to reopen next month.

candidate: The bakery sells fresh bread every morning.
reference: The bakery offers newly baked bread each morning.

candidate: She forgot her umbrella and got wet in the rain.
reference: She didn't bring her umbrella and ended up getting soaked.

candidate: The concert tickets sold out in minutes.
reference: All concert tickets were purchased within a few minutes.

candidate: The police are investigating the cause of the fire.
reference: Authorities are looking into what caused the fire.

candidate: He couldn't attend the meeting because he was sick.
reference: He missed the meeting due to illness.

candidate: The phone's camera quality has improved with the update.
reference: The latest update upgraded the phone camera’s quality.

candidate: Tourists visited the ancient ruins throughout the summer.
reference: All summer long, tourists came to see the ancient ruins.

candidate: She left a note before going out.
reference: She wrote a message and left it before leaving the house.

candidate: The team trained every day before the tournament.
reference: Daily practice sessions were held by the team ahead of the tournament.

candidate: The shop owner raised the prices after demand increased.
reference: The prices went up because more customers were buying the products.

candidate: He lost his keys while jogging in the park.
reference: His keys went missing when he was running in the park.

candidate: The actor received an award for best performance.
reference: The actor won an award for delivering the best performance.

candidate: She misplaced her glasses again.
reference: She once again couldn’t find where she put her glasses.

candidate: The event was cancelled due to lack of funding.
reference: The event could not take place because there was no funding.

candidate: The laptop overheated after running too many programs.
reference: Too many applications running at once caused the laptop to overheat.

candidate: The baby started walking at eleven months.
reference: The child took their first steps at eleven months old.

candidate: He replaced the old lightbulb with a new one.
reference: The old bulb was removed and a new one was installed.

candidate: The school introduced a new dress code.
reference: A new uniform policy was implemented at the school.

candidate: She always forgets her passwords.
reference: She consistently fails to remember her passwords.

candidate: The package arrived earlier than expected.
reference: The delivery showed up sooner than planned.

candidate: He recorded the lecture for later review.
reference: He made an audio recording of the lecture to listen to later.

candidate: The storm damaged several houses along the coast.
reference: Many coastal houses were harmed by the storm.

candidate: The dog escaped through an open gate.
reference: The dog got out because the gate had been left open.

candidate: She bought a gift for her friend's birthday.
reference: A birthday present was purchased for her friend.

candidate: Workers are repairing the road this week.
reference: Road repairs are being carried out by workers this week.

candidate: He donated blood at the hospital.
reference: He gave blood during a hospital donation drive.

candidate: The teacher uploaded the notes to the online portal.
reference: The teacher posted the class notes on the website.

candidate: She backed up all her files to the cloud.
reference: She saved copies of her files to cloud storage.

candidate: The bus was completely full during rush hour.
reference: There were no seats left on the bus at rush hour.

candidate: He found a wallet on the street and returned it.
reference: A wallet he found on the street was returned to its owner.

candidate: The nurse checked his blood pressure twice.
reference: His blood pressure was measured two times by the nurse.

candidate: The football team hired a new coach.
reference: A new coach has been appointed to lead the football team.

candidate: She ordered the wrong size and had to return it.
reference: She sent the item back because she ordered the wrong size.

candidate: The website crashed because too many users logged in at once.
reference: A surge of users caused the website to go offline.

candidate: He stayed up late finishing the assignment.
reference: He worked on the assignment until very late at night.

candidate: The neighbours complained about the loud music.
reference: The neighbours filed a complaint because the music was too loud.

candidate: The festival attracted thousands of visitors.
reference: Thousands of people attended the festival.

candidate: He subscribed to a monthly streaming service.
reference: He signed up for a streaming subscription that renews every month.

candidate: The truck delivered supplies to the supermarket.
reference: A shipment of supplies was dropped off at the supermarket by truck.

candidate: She tested positive for the flu and was told to rest.
reference: She was diagnosed with the flu and advised to rest.

candidate: The bridge was closed for safety inspections.
reference: A safety inspection led to the temporary closure of the bridge.

candidate: He forgot to charge his phone before sleeping.
reference: He went to bed without plugging in his phone.

candidate: The artist exhibited her paintings in a local gallery.
reference: Her artwork was displayed at a gallery in town.

candidate: The city is building a new bike lane downtown.
reference: A new bike lane is under construction in the city center.
